result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

no contact with MRO 4-11-1997, her residence or any residence she is residing at, absolute sobriety, no illegal drugs, only prescription medication with a valid prescription, no travel outside the State without prior court approval, no entry into any Class B licensed establishments
Status conference on March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

10:35 AM Defendant VINCE N CROW in court.  Atty. Joseph J. Kaupie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Warrant was authorized for the Def.'s failure to appear in Court per Atty. Kaupie. Atty. Kaupie requests the Court vacate the warrant authorized for the Def. and that the Court reinstate his prior bond. Requests granted - the Court vacates the warrant authorized and reinstates the Def.'s prior bond. Def. is Ordered to contact the Public Def.'s Office to inquire on new counsel being appointed since Atty. Haase has left their office.  Status conference scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders $2500 warrant - WI & surrounding states, begin forfeiture of previous bond and notes officer/witness is off duty.
